conclusion: Two identical thin-walled glasses, A and B, contain sucrose water with different concentrations.
Two identical monochromatic light beams illuminate the glasses at the same incident angle θ.
The greater the concentration of sucrose water, the greater the refractive index of light.
The refractive index of light is inversely proportional to the angle of incidence.
Since β1 > β2, the refractive index in cup A is less than in cup B.
Given the refractive index is greater with higher sucrose concentration, cup B has higher sucrose concentration than cup A.
Therefore, the concentration of sucrose water in cup A is lower than that in cup B.
